radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Stereo imaging of the optic nerves
radiographic_examinations.findings: Presence of tilted discs in 75.0% (24/32) and peripapillary atrophy in 81.3% (26/32) of nerves; Cup-to-disc ratios ranged from 0.20 to 0.95 and averaged 0.56.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No changes in optic nerve appearance or visual field defects were observed over the follow-up period of up to 7 years.

radiographic_examinations.findings: The most common visual field defect was an arcuate defect, found in 31.3% (10/32) of patients.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No significant change in visual field defects was observed during the follow-up period.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Static automated white on white threshold perimetry
radiographic_examinations.findings: Initial visual field defects were stable, showing no significant change over time.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Visual field exams revealed no significant change in size or intensity of defects over the follow-up period.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Optic nerve appearance remained similar between the initial presentation in 1997 and the follow-up in 2005.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No change was noted in the extent of nerve fiber defect between 1997 and 2005.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Initial visual field showed arcuate and nasal step defects.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Field defects remained stable over both 8 years (Case 1) and 5 years (Case 2) follow-up periods.
